description: From Middle English incurren, from Anglo-Norman encurir, Middle French encourir, from Old French encorre, from Latin incurrere.

verbs.description: incur (third-person singular simple present incurs, present participle incurring, simple past and past participle incurred)

definitionGroups.group: (transitive) to bring upon oneself or expose oneself to, especially something inconvenient, harmful, or onerous; to become liable or subject to

entries.meaning: (chiefly law, accounting) to render somebody liable or subject to
examples: The least neglect of duty will incur[...] the penalty of thirty-nine well laid on in the morning.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) to enter or pass into
(obsolete, intransitive) to fall within a period or scope; to occur; to run into danger
